title: Brewers rout Pirates, extend winning streak to league-leading 11 games
description: At 75-44, Milwaukee has quickly become far and away MLB's best team, five games better than the next-closest club.
content:
The Milwaukee Brewers scored early and often against the Pittsburgh Pirates and ace Paul Skenes, routing Pittsburgh 14-0 to extend their win streak to a league-leading 11 games. At 75-44, Milwaukee has quickly become far and away MLB’s best team, five games better than the next-closest club.

Leadoff hitter Sal Frelick got the scoring started in the first inning on a full-count home run, and things quickly unraveled for Skenes from there. The 2024 National League rookie of the year lasted just four innings, allowing four runs on six hits and 93 pitches.

The Pirates’ relief corps wasn’t much better, allowing an additional 10 runs over the remaining four innings, including a three-run homer from Andrew Vaughn in the sixth before ultimately conceding the game with a position player on the mound.

For his part, Freddy Peralta tossed six scoreless innings with seven strikeouts, lowering his ERA to 2.90. Milwaukee then deployed Grant Anderson, Aaron Ashby and utilityman Anthony Seigler to seal the win, pushing its lead in the NL Central to 7 1/2 games over the Chicago Cubs.

If some of that sounds familiar to Brewers fans, that’s because it eerily is. Tuesday’s start tied for Skenes’ second-shortest outing of the 2025 campaign, and his four earned runs are the second most he has permitted all season. On June 25, Skenes also lasted just four innings and allowed four runs, against none other than these same Brewers.

Not only have the Brewers rocked Skenes once before, but this is also Milwaukee’s second win streak of 11 games this season, having won 11 straight from July 6 to July 21. With two separate win streaks of at least 10 games in the same season, the Brewers became the 10th team in MLB history to accomplish the feat. Of the nine previous teams to reach that mark, three made it to the World Series.
summary: The Milwaukee Brewers have extended their winning streak to a league-leading 11 games, with a 14-0 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates. The victory puts the team at 75-44, five games ahead of the next-closest team. Leadoff hitter Sal Frelick started the scoring in the first inning, with ace Paul Skenes allowing four runs in four innings. The Pirates' relief department allowed an additional 10 runs over the remaining four innings, including a three-run homer from Andrew Vaughn. Freddy Peralta also pitched six scoreless innings, lowering his ERA to 2.90, and the win increases Milwaukee's lead in the NL Central to 7 1/2.
shortSummary: The Milwaukee Brewers extended their winning streak to 11 games with a 14-0 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates, highlighted by Skenes' poor performance.
argos_summary: The Milwaukee Brewers dominated the Pittsburgh Pirates with a 14-0 victory, extending their win streak to 11 games and solidifying their position as the best team in MLB at 75-44. Sal Frelick's home run ignited the scoring, while ace Paul Skenes struggled, allowing four runs in just four innings. Freddy Peralta excelled with six scoreless innings, and the Brewers' relief pitchers contributed to the rout, pushing their lead in the NL Central to 7.5 games over the Chicago Cubs.
